An Ice warrior is a monster similar in appearance to a knight in blue, somewhat translucent armour. They reside near ice or in frozen caves and are most easily fought in the Asgarnian Ice Dungeon. Ice warriors are not aggressive to players with a combat level of 109 and above.

Mid-level food (such as lobsters, swordfish, or beltfish) is recommended for players between the combat levels of 70 and 90, as any type of food above that will likely be a waste of money. Higher-levelled players will likely need little to no food.

Ice warriors appear to be wielding longswords, but their attack speed is 4.

Ice warriors can be safe spotted on White Wolf Mountain by standing next to the rock slide. Loot cannot be picked up without level 50 Mining.

Locations[edit | edit source]

White Wolf Mountain40None2Maplink
Ice Queen's Lair40None14Maplink
Asgarnian Ice Dungeon40None11Maplink
Chaos Tunnels40None6Maplink

Training spots[edit | edit source]

There are ice warriors mixed with three ice giants in the dungeon just south of Port Sarim. There is also a room full of ice warriors guarding the Ice Queen under White Wolf Mountain (level 50 mining is required to enter), however it is a long walk through tunnels of ice spiders and ice giants. It may be a good idea to bring a summoning familiar or a dwarf multicannon. Attacking the Ice Queen will result in the player being attacked by all of the ice warriors in the area at once, although there are some safe spots from warriors while fighting her.

Rare drop table[edit | edit source]

Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but they will increase the chance of accessing the rare drop table and may also improve the loot received from it.

These items are dropped alongside main drops.

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 12 February 2024 (Update):
    • Rebalanced several low level monsters that were harder to kill than intended
  • update 1 August 2022 (Update):
    • Removed the ice warriors, ice giants and ice spiders from the Frozen Waste Plateau, replacing them with glacors, wyverns and acheron mammoths respectively.
  • patch 16 January 2017 (Update):
    • Ice warriors that were inconsistently weak to air, water or earth are now weak to fire.
  • patch 9 November 2009 (Update):
    • Fixed a long standing issue where ice warriors would lose the transparency of their models in combat.
  • update 24 May 2001 (Update):
    • Added to game.
    • The Asgarnian Ice Dungeon has been expanded and improved.
      • It now also includes the new ice warrior monsters.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Ice warriors still use the walk, stand and death animations of old RuneScape.
  • Ice warriors appear to have the old model of armour.
  • While the ones in the Asgarnian Ice Dungeon have a male voice when they are hit and die, the ones near the Ice Queen have a female voice. It is unknown if this was intentional or not.
  • Two ice warriors in the Asgarnian Ice Dungeon and the ones near the Ice Queen display used to be weak to water spells. This was changed in the patch notes on 16 January 2017.
